title: Kari Lake loses suit over her defeat in Arizona governor’s race
description: On Saturday, a judge rejected the republican candidate's claim that problems with ballot printers at some polling places on Election Day were the result of intentional misconduct. Kari Lake said she will appeal the ruling.

title: Ten killed in fuel tanker explosion near Johannesburg
description: A tanker, transporting liquefied petroleum gas, was caught beneath a bridge close to a hospital and houses in Boksburg, on Saturday morning.

title: How to help the human body adapt to extreme temperatures
description: As the number of heat-related deaths around the world has increased by 68% in the last 15 years, researchers in Australia and Canada are measuring the impact of heat stress on organisms.

title: Paris shooting suspect's custody lifted for health reasons
description: Prosecutors said the man suspected of killing three Kurds was taken to a psychiatric unit.

title: Cholera vaccine supplies are insufficient to counter new surge
description: The spread of the disease, transmitted by dirty water and poor sanitation in areas stricken by conflict and poverty, is also partly fuelled by climate change.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban ban women from working for NGOs
description: The ban applies to domestic and foreign entities. It comes days after the Taliban banned women from attending university.

title: Bugs, fraud and cyberattacks: The technical challenges for Paris 2024 Olympics ticketing
description: More than 13 million tickets are on sale for the Olympic and Paralympic Games, making them a prime target.

title: Arctic cold prevents Americans from celebrating first normal Christmas since pandemic
description: The cold wave and snow blizzards across the country caused the cancellation of more than 8,000 flights and left more than a million people without power, from the Canadian border to Texas. At least nine people have died in road accidents.

title: Taliban use water cannon on women protesting university ban
description: On Tuesday, Afghanistan's rulers banned women from attending univesity.

title: Christmas gifts: A long history from ancient Rome to today
description: Many families find it difficult to imagine Christmas without giving or receiving gifts, especially when there are children. But the practice has had different meanings throughout the ages.

title: Paris shooting: Kurds and antiracism groups gather after death of three
description: Three Kurds were killed in an attack in Paris on Friday by a 69-year-old man, who was previously charged with attacking migrants.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon puts left-wing NUPES alliance through the wringer
description: Though the left-wing leader was behind the alliance's birth, he has not treated it delicately in recent months. All eyes are already set on the 2027 presidential election.

title: Notre-Dame reconstruction: Cathedral freed from 'fog', but not friction
description: As the new archbishop of Paris oversees the work needed to rebuild the 800-year-old cathedral by a 2024 deadline, senior figures have been contending over how to restore it.

title: How Santa Claus became Finnish
description: It was a visit in 1950 by former US first lady Eleanor Roosevelt to Rovaniemi, in Finnish Lapland, that sealed Santa Claus' official place of residence.

title: War in Ukraine: Kherson shelled, Zelensky blasts Russian 'terror'
description: At least five people were killed and 20 injured in the strikes on Saturday.

title: Could Resistance fighters Missak and Mélinée Manouchian be next to enter France's Pantheon?
description: President Emmanuel Macron wants to induct Missak and Mélinée Manouchian, a couple of Armenian immigrants who became figures of the Resistance, to the Pantheon in early 2024.

title: 'Serpent' serial killer Charles Sobhraj arrives in France after Nepal release
description: After 20 years in prison in Nepal, the killer was deported to France, where he is 'not wanted' by authorities.

title: Paracetamol, amoxicillin: Pediatric drug shortages worry French professionals
description: Infections in children and supply shortages from China, where the raw materials are produced, are on the rise at the end of 2022.

title: Israel's Supreme Court under attack from new coalition
description: The right-wing majority wants to break the judges' judicial supervision over its laws. Critics fear 'a regime change'.

title: Cold snap in the US: 'The most impressive thing is how quickly temperatures plummeted'
description: Frédéric Nathan, a weather forecaster at Météo-France, analyzes the intense cold spell that is paralyzing the United States.

title: 'Energy security in central and eastern Europe is crucial for our economic future'
description: Given the disruptions to Russian gas supplies, Germany and its eastern neighbors must rethink the routes of their energy supplies, in cooperation with the European Union, writes researcher Guntram Wolff.

title: The geopolitics of Santa Claus
description: From Saint Nicholas to Sinterklaas, the Crusades to Coca-Cola – the pathway of a myth and a thousand-year battle over its origins.

title: The French government postpones bird flu vaccination deadline to fall 2023
description: France is confronted with a worsening epizootic that has led to the early slaughter of 3.3 million poultry.

title: Hungary: Viktor Orban continues his anti-European rhetoric
description: Isolated within the EU, notably for his closeness to Putin, the Hungarian Prime Minister denounced Europe's discrimination against his country.

title: In Kenya, Lake Victoria is dying of overexploitation
description: While the government looks away, the second largest body of fresh water in the world is being suffocated by chemical waste and overfishing.

title: In Ukraine, security services target the Orthodox Church
description: Suspected of being centers of Russian influence – ninteneen monastatries, cathedrals and churches have been searched by Ukranian security services.

title: A not-so-white-Christmas: Snow is becoming an endangered sight in Europe
description: Projections from the latest climate models show that snowfall during the months of December and January will decline markedly over part of the continent.

title: How French emergency rooms are dealing with the stressful holiday season
description: From Paris to Toulouse, the same concerns are being voiced in French healthcare services: there are shortages of staff and beds, even as epidemics are rife.

title: 'Qatargate': Michel Claise, the judge who 'followed the money' in EU corruption scandal
description: The Belgian magistrate behind the arrest of six people in Brussels, including three MEPs suspected of having received money from Qatar, has an impressive track record.

title: Rapper Tory Lanez found guilty of shooting Megan Thee Stallion
description: After a celebrity party near Hollywood in 2020, Mr. Lanez shot at her feet when she got out of a car they were both riding in.
